page.title: 01General review of the region
page.content: The area stretches from the outlying houses of the village of Gretton in the north to the edge of an industrial zone on the outskirts of Corby in the south east, which has been developed on land reclaimed from opencast iron ore mining.To the south west reclaimed land has been planted with coniferous and some deciduous trees.A recent waymarked public footpath from Gretton Brook Road to Gretton passes through these woods before coming to the open farmland that is to be found beyond the old mining sites.Pheasant covers and shooting hides are to be found in the woods and add to the leisure and recreational provision.The northbound main lines of the Midland railway to Nottingham from Glendon south Junction near Kettering pass through the region including most of the mile long Corby tunnel.
